text: Alien intruder. Transporter Room Three. Security alert. Alien...
I did, sir.
I did. I really did. Ships in bottles. Great fun.
Locked on to the Main Bridge, Captain...
Not sure. The secondary power bus may need adjusting.
On... hers, sir.
Sir, Commander Shelby and Data beamed down to the planet surface an hour ago...
The surface environment is safe for transport, Commander.
We've matched warp velocity for transport, Commander.
At what point should I shut it down if there's a problem?
Locked in...
Positronic activity unchanged...
Sir, your submicron matrix activity is increasing exponentially.
The Borg have adapted their electromagnetic field to prevent main Transporter functions, sir...
The Borg might be trying to terminate their link with him...
Transport successful, sir...
He discovered the site-to-site lockout. I wouldn't be surprised if he tries to make it to a transporter room now.
He's reactivating the site-to-site transport interlocks.
I wouldn't advise that, sir. The phase coils don't take well to ricochets.

I'm afraid I've done all I can, sir. As soon as he realized we had knocked out the primary power bus he put up force fields around the secondaries. I don't recommend anyone going near those circuits now.
The force field only seems to go across the front of the pad, sir. Security should be able to cut through from behind.
Whenever you say, sir.
All systems functioning.
Got him! Sir! He's on the Romulan ship.
I've got a fix on the energy source, and for the moment this baby...  ... is working, but that could change in an instant.
I've lost him!
Open, sir.
Scanning, sir. Got him.
Go ahead, Commander.
I can't hold him, Commander.
I've got a piece of him Commander. But that's all...
Link confirmed. Ready whenever you are, sir.
O'Brien here, Commander.
The field's still deflecting the signal. There just isn't enough of him, sir.
Am I intruding, Commander?
Just talk with her... try to make her see reason. She's going off half-cocked and not thinking this through. You've worked with her for a long time... she respects your opinion.
No, sir. In fact, we replaced the transition coils only a week ago.
No, sir... really... I'm fine. I came here to... to ask for your help.  It's about Keiko... I'd like you to talk to her... convince her to go through with the wedding.
No, thank you, sir. First of all... I'd like to apologize for this morning in Ten Forward...
Nothing that I could see... their shields were down... there was no power interruption... no subspace bias.
Oh?
She already has... it didn't help.  You've known her longer than I have... I just thought she might listen to you.
She what?  Cancelled the wedding? Today? Without even a word... of all the childish, selfish... !
She won't even talk to me...
Thank you, sir. I won't forget this.

The signal lock wasn't broken, sir. I had just entered the transfer sequence when the Ambassador's pattern began to break up. I tried to go to emergency manual control, but the pattern deteriorated too rapidly and...
Uh... no sir. Thank you, sir.
(reading aft science console} We've lost primary life-support. Switching to secondary systems. Impulse and warp engines are offline.
Are you all right?
Aye aye, sir.
Aye, sir.
Can you sense anything, Counselor?
Confinement mode.
Counselor...
Counselor?
Eighteen percent... twenty... twenty-five...
Ensign -- there's a thermal inversion in the power coupling!
Excuse me, sir, but that's damn cold-blooded. What about the people down there?
Good-bye, Michael.
Have to go -- I've got a transporter simulation to run on the bridge.
How'd you do that?
I believe Counselor Troi is the senior officer on the bridge.
I recommend we initiate emergency procedure alpha two.  By-pass computer control and place all systems on manual override.
I'm not sure who to feel sorry for... the captain or the kids.
If it falls to fifteen percent... the field will collapse and there'll be a containment breach.
If it's a boy... Michael. After my father.
If the computer senses a hull breach, it automatically closes emergency bulkheads to isolate the breach. Until we can clear those bulkheads, we'll be cut-off from the rest of the ship.
If the containment field strength keeps dropping at this rate, we still have at least two hours before it becomes critical.
Lieutenant Monroe was in command, but he's dead.
No... that's a completely different phenomenon.
She carries the rank of Lieutenant Commander.
Sir... the field strength is stabilizing...
Switch to primary bypass...
That's a completely improper procedure. You can't dump that much raw energy into a bridge terminal without---
The computer's down, looks like we still have impulse power... but not much else...
There's no evidence they're dead, either. If you were trapped down there, would you want us to cut you loose and leave?
There. Just before the second time we were hit... see the subspace distortion?
They can be hundreds of meters long, but they have almost no mass... which is why they're so difficult to detect.

This is the Federation Starship Enterprise calling any vessel within range. We are in distress and need assistance. Please respond.  I'm still not sure we're even transmitting. I'll set the message on auto-repeat and see if we get a response.
We talked about this last night.
We were hit by a quantum filament. Most of our systems are down and we haven't been able to contact anyone off the bridge.
We're not in danger until it drops below fifteen percent. We can afford to wait and see if anyone in engineering notices those monitors.
What about Ten Forward?  My... wife is there.
When the filament hit us, the ship was momentarily charged... as if it had... come into contact with a live electrical wire.
Yes, sir.
Yes... but my readings indicate there's no power down there. They don't even have monitors to tell them there's a problem.
You what?
All set.
I believe we can beam the probe aboard while we're still travelling at Warp Nine.
Will do.  Transporter beam locked, Captain.
Yes, Lieutenant.
I'm sorry, Commander... There's just no way to lock in on anything down there...
The electrical storms are creating thousands of ghosts...
Ensign Crusher.
If you ever touch my transporter again... I'll kill you.
This just got a lot harder.
We recalibrated the transporter setting for the tightest possible beam.
Acknowledged, Bobruisk. Energizing.
I know what you mean, Lieutenant.
Last time my old man came on board I found him chasing Nurse Stanton around a biobed in Sickbay...
Miles Edward O'Brien. Good to meet you, sir.
Nossir.
Well, you know women.
Yeah, but it's always something with parents, isn't it, sir...
Have you tried this?
I'll check.  Chief O'Brien to bridge.
Thanks. Wait till you see her -- she's the spitting image of her dad.
The senior staff is holding a meeting. You're supposed to go to your mother's quarters.
Welcome back, Wesley.
Wesley Crusher has arrived and wants to know if he can stop by the observation lounge...  To say "hi".
I'll, uh... go check the pattern buffers.
I'm sorry, Counselor, but... I'm not sure what to do here.
Aye, sir.
Dammit..
I was synchronizing the phase transition coils... I didn't do anything I haven't done a hundred times before...
The test object is made of pure duranium.
Watch this...
I'm losing him... what the hell... ?
A party for Worf? That sounds intriguing. I'd be delighted --
Career?
Female?
I know her too, but we don't do that.
My lips are sealed.
No harm in checking, I guess.
No problem. We're totally ship-shape.
That is trouble. You choose your friends... you choose your enemies... But family... that's in the stars.
That's right. The animal's head exploded just like --
They find anything yet?
Those are Klingon painstiks. I once saw one of them used against a two-ton Rectyne Monopod. Poor creature jumped five meters at the slightest touch. Finally died from excessive cephalic pressures --
And a very good job of it she does, too...
Aye, sir, we got him.
Come on... it wasn't half a meter...
I'm having trouble locking on, sir.
It was wonderful.
Right away!
Shoo! Shoo, damn you!
Yes, sir.
There's a transformer substation directly above the chamber she just entered. It's masking her signal.
There's nothing to lock onto, Commander.
Whenever you're ready.
Yessir... three hundred meters beyond the colony perimeter...
Aye. I'll have them kept out of the way here.
Bitter experience has taught me it's a fundamental truth.
Hold it, that's my chair. My luck is always lousy unless I start on the dealer's left.
Instinct, Data, instinct.  The game is seven card high/low with a buy on the last card. And just to make it interesting the man with the axe takes all.
Time to pluck a pigeon.
Too rich for me.
Could you take a look at the pattern buffers? Considering what's happened, I'm not sure the control systems are reliable...
I was with Keiko... in the Arboretum.
I've run a level-1 diagnostic. As far as I can tell, the unit hasn't been tampered with.
It's nothing, just a little cold.
My technicians have examined all of the Enterprise's transporters, sir.  I can assure you, this is the only unit which has been tampered with...
No, I better go back to my quarters and change. Don't think twice about it, Commander...
No, nothing serious...
Right, Commander.
You're talking about thirty or forty chips in half a dozen different control systems.
Ghost stories...
Gillespie, sit down... you're not helping matters any...
How's that?
I think you know exactly what I'm saying.
I'm surprised at you, Gillespie... a Starfleet officer...  I have more to worry about than shades and spirits...
I've been drinking too much coffee... maybe some hot tea, Guinan?
Is that why you were late?
Like what?
She has work to do. She heads up the plant biology lab, you know.
Tom Corbin. From the science lab.  Remember him?
Was Tom Corbin there?
You take me for a fool?
You use any excuse to pay him a visit...
I just woke up, sir.
No problem. I'll have him out of there as smooth as ice.
On the bridge.
Right sir, just standing here dozing off.
There's gonna be hell to pay.
Where are you going?
You're going to take that?
For a moment, we weren't sure you left the space station in time...
I don't know, Captain.
It just exploded, sir.
Not yet, Captain. I'm having trouble clearing the signal...
Stand by, Commander. Engaging transport.
Transporter Room to Engineering. I have a power drain...
Yessir.
And I know who this is...
Aye, sir.
By creating our own access code, we will be able to prevent anyone from using the transporter against us as we move to the cargo bay...
Deck thirty-six. Engineering.
Great spot for a picnic, sir.
How do you feel?
Hungry.
I can boost the confinement beam. One person might be able to make it...
I gave you that...
I have initialized the transporter signal...
I hid the bracelet... in your pocket. You were... surprised.
I know how to override the bridge command...
I know you. I know who you are...
I will require some assistance.
I'd really like to get us out of here before it hits, Commander... see, I'm supposed to be feeding the baby lunch... Molly gets in a terribly foul mood if I'm late...
If I could've killed that thing inside me... I would have...
In a place called McKinley Park. Green grass... tall trees.
No. Make it stop.
No... I would have to use a transporter pad.
On the floor!
Sir, let me beam down with a pattern enhancer...
Ten Forward to bridge. I said all transporter controls. Including those aboard all your shuttlecraft.
Thank you, sir.
That is not true...
The computer will not allow us to override an emergency forcefield command...
Their communicators. Now they will learn nothing but what we tell them.

They could use the transporter against us... Once the forcefield's down, they could beam us back to the surface.  But there is a way to neutralize that threat...  Bridge, transfer all transporter functions to Ten Forward...
They're lying...
This way!
Transporter controls are being transferred...
We are on deck ten.
We are still in control of these three bodies. We will not leave them.
We need to distribute the enhancer rods at seven meter legs... that ought to do it...
What would you tell him to do?
You said, "You make me so happy, Miles."
You were correct. They are attempting to engage their transporters. But I know how to shut them down.
You.
But at the same time, you know I wouldn't want to lose her...
Oh, I couldn't ask her to do that...
The truth is I'm a career man... you know, married to my job... Mitzi doesn't understand that... I like her a lot... but I just don't think I'm ready for two marriages if you know what I mean...
I have laid in coordinates which should set you down in the least damaged section of the Borg ship.
Black... double sweet...
Careful... that's hot...
I could use a... cup of coffee. How about you?
I didn't say that. But until they find a way to reverse this... this effect... it's going to be hard for me to ignore the fact that you're a little girl.
I don't know.
I'll be right back.
I'm trying, sir... I can't get a pattern lock.
I've got them.  There's a forty percent drop in mass. I may have lost one of them...
It's going to be all right... I promise... we'll work this out...
It's... I don't know... but this feels wrong, somehow.
Keiko...
Looks like tritanium from the hull.
No wonder the bulkhead shattered...
No. I mean, of course you're my wife... but you're also ten years old.
Phase inducers activated... energy levels nominal...
Sorry.
Technically, yes.
That's not the point.
There are some bulkhead fragments over here.
Transposition matrix locked in...
What if Daddy reads you a story tonight? Will that be okay?
What's wrong, Sweetheart?
When I tried to beam them off, I wasn't able to get a lock because the reversion field was masking part of their patterns.
A few years back, I was called in to re-route an emitter array at a Starbase on Zayra Four. Turns out the entire system was infested with Talarian hook spiders.  Ever see a Talarian hook spider?
After fifteen seconds or so in the beam, you may start to feel lightheaded. Try to stay calm... and it's important you don't move around too much.
Aye sir.
Aye, sir...
Christina -- Lieutenant Barclay.
Don't worry -- I can hold him together...
Emitter pad... targeting scanner -- they're all running normally. This system's clean... so is the science vessel's.
Energizing.
Energizing.
Engaging interlock...  Buffers in synch...
Engaging interlock...  Buffers synched...
Engaging system interlock...  Pattern buffers synchronized...
Four, five seconds... about twice the normal time.
He's there.
His signal resolution's down to fifty percent... we need to bring him back...
I found her on Titus Four... almost stepped on her by accident.
I guess so... but if you don't mind my asking, sir... what for?
I know how you feel about this, sir.
I thought you might like to meet Christina.
I'll get us a couple of drinks. Keep an eye on her, will you?
I'll have to send you over one at a time... because of band-width limitations. And the transport cycle will take a bit longer.
I'll run a scan on the Heisenberg compensators...
I'll try increasing molecular dispersion...
I'm reading a ninety-two percent increase in mass, sir!
I'm setting up a force field around the chamber...
If you don't mind my making an observation...  You forgot to bring a tricorder.
Initializing the back-up pattern buffer. Holding at stand by...
It was the hardest thing I ever did. But I got through it. After that, I was never quite as afraid of spiders.
It's nothing to worry about, sir.
Lieutenant -- glad you could make it.
Lycosa tarantula. Don't worry, she won't bite.
Molecular resolution at sixty percent... engaging static mode... his pattern is locked and holding...
No -- of arachnids.  Spiders. Sickening, crawly little things, don't you think? All those legs...
No problem at all. Why don't you give me a hand?
Okay... Energizing.
Phase coils...
Phase transition coils at stand-by...  Energizing.
Programming bio-filter...
Should be a smooth ride over, sir.
Signal's holding...
Sir, begging your pardon -- but couldn't this wait til morning?
Sir?
Stand by, Commander.
Stand by, sir.
Stand by, sir...
That's why each pad has four redundant scanners. If any one scanner fails, the other three take over.
The confinement beam subsystems check out. So do the phase transition coils.
Their legs are half a meter long.  Anyway, I had a choice. Do I walk away and let the emitter blow itself to hell... or do I crawl into a Jeffries Tube with twenty hook spiders?
There may be a small amount of static charge accumulation. You'll feel a bit of tingling -- nothing to worry about.
They're just ionic fluctuations, sir. A result of our interlock with the Yosemite's transporter system.
This'll only take a minute...
Transporter Psychosis -- there hasn't been a case of that in over fifty years. Not since they perfected multiplex pattern buffers.
We can do it from right here.
Whoa, wait a minute...  I'm reading an ionic fluctuation in the matter stream... No problem.
Why?
With all due respect sir -- I've been doing this for twenty-two years, and I haven't lost anybody yet.
Yes sir, I can.
You know, I think this is the first time we've ever talked, outside the Transporter Room.
You see, sir? That wasn't so bad, was it?
You're in for a bumpy ride, Commander.
You're sure about this, sir?
Aye, sir.
Aye, sir.
Aye, sir.
Captain, the net has picked up five cloaked ships... they're stationary... about five thousand kilometers directly ahead.
Could be, sir.
It's localized to this segment of the net...
New readings...  Romulan ship decloaking!
No uncloaked ships within sensor range... a few subspace anomalies, but nothing firm.
Shall I raise shields?
Sir, the detection net is picking up activity from the Romulans... fifteen cloaked ships... spreading out along the border.
Sir... I've lost track of three ships already... and the rest of the convoy is moving toward the disruption.
Sir... the Sutherland isn't heading for the rendezvous point. She's come to a full stop.
The Endeavor has cleared the dock, Captain. All ships standing by.
There's a disruption in the tachyon detectors!
They're hailing us, sir.
We're crossing into Klingon territory, Captain.
But I feel fine.
Doctor Quaice? Was he part of the regular crew rotation?
Doctor, it won't do any good to check my eyesight. I didn't see your friend.
I'm sorry. I do remember you were here for a short while. But you were alone.
My pleasure, Doctor.

No, Doctor. As far as I can recall, you came in, looked around for a few moments... I asked you if I could help you with anything... All you said was "Thank you." I said "My pleasure," or something. That was the end of it. There was no one else here.
That was my watch. I beamed this man onboard?
When did he arrive?
Give me a moment, gents. We're dealing with an extremely narrow access point.
Come on fella... this is our table.
Didn't your mother teach you manners?
Excuse me, we were sitting here.
I suppose you're right.
There seems to be a question of who's table this is.
Apparently not.
Here's the biofilter's analysis of the microbes.
Hmm... I hope these are the right coordinates...
I can override and beam Commander Riker aboard...
The transporter has detected unidentified microbes in Commander Riker's body.
O'Brien to bridge.
Hey Doc... I'm dying here.
I was... uh... kayaking on the Holodeck again.
The pain's gone.
"The minstrel boy to the war is gone... In the ranks of death you'll find him... "
... minstrel boy to the war is gone...
A bunch of us used to sing it together... on the Rutledge. I haven't thought about it for years...
And Captain Maxwell, he'd never retaliate out of vengeance, no matter what that Cardassian says. They're up to something... they're the ones you should be investigating, sir, not Captain Maxwell.
And slip right through...
Anything I can do, sir, you know that.
Aye, sir.
But who I choose to spend my free time with... that's my business.
Capers. But the fighting is over now. Why would anyone still feel... however they feel?
Captain Maxwell would never --
Captain Maxwell? I'm proud to say I did.
Captain... ?

Cardassians were advancing on us, moving through the streets, destroying, killing... I was with a group of women and children when two Cardassian soldiers burst in... I stunned the one, but the other jumped me... we struggled... one of the women threw me a phaser and I fired...
Deck six.
He will, you can count on it.
He won't do that, sir...
He's a rare one, all right.  I count myself lucky, sir -- I've served with the two finest Captains in Starfleet.
Hello, Captain. Good to see you again.
I don't know what to say, sir... he must've had his reasons...
I guess that's true.  I hadn't thought of it like that.
I had the thought that if I talked to you... we could figure a way out of this mess.
I like them fine. It's just... well, I know them. You learn to watch your back around those people.
I think so. The Phoenix should be following standard Starfleet protocols. They have to align their shields at the start of every sweep.
I wanted to say... I... I owe you an apology.
I was on Setlik Three.
I'd just like to say... he's a good man, sir... What he did was terribly wrong, I know that now... but I'm still proud to have served with him.
I'd say he took it well. Oh, I know he was broken up inside... who wouldn't be? But you'd never know it to see him. He never missed a minute's duty, always had a smile and a joke...
I'll have to get Commander La Forge's approval on that.
I'm not armed.
I'm... trying to understand. The people who hang onto -- grudges. Seems to me they ought to be able to put those feelings aside... once the fighting's done with.
I've been monitoring his sweep patterns... I'm telling you, I can compensate...
If my commander tells me to discuss the Transporter with you, I will. If Captain Picard orders me to tell you everything I know about Ben Maxwell, I will.
If that's true, I learned it from you, sir.
If that's true, sir, there was a reason for it. I'd bank my life on that.
It's good we're trying this with another Federation ship. It would never work with an alien vessel.
It's not you I hate, Cardassian. I hate what I became... because of you.
Kanar... never could develop a taste for it.
Keiko, I've been thinking... You've introduced me to all the wonderful foods you're accustomed to... I'd like to do the same.  Isn't that what marriage is about? Sharing?
Like a chef. She was fantastic. Of course, I'll have to use the replicator... but I'll make something special for you tonight. You'll love it, I promise.
Me? I feel... fine. I mean... the war's over now.
Mind if I join you?
More like sabotage, sir. It was on Setlik Three. A squad of Cardassian militia made a sneak attack on an outpost... wiped out close to a hundred civilians.
No oatmeal -- or muffins? How about corned beef and eggs?
No, you'll love it, I promise.  I can still remember the aromas when my mother was cooking...
Nossir.

Oh... about war, and glory...  "The minstrel boy to the war is gone; In the ranks of death you'll find him; His father's sword he hath girded on; And his wild harp slung behind him."  ... Captain Maxwell always liked that song...  I guess all this business with him and the Cardassians... brought it back.
Scalloped potatoes... mutton shanks... oxtails and cabbage...
She didn't believe in a replicator. She thought real food was more nutritious.
Shouldn't have... popped off like that. In the Turbolift.
Sir, Captain Maxwell... if he feels his back is to the wall, he'll strike...
Sir, there is no war... the war is over.
Sir? Let me beam over... try to talk to him.
Something's wrong...
Sweetheart... I'm not a fish.
Thank you, sir.
That's not what I meant --
That's what everybody thinks about the enemy. That's probably what they think about us.
The Phoenix is using a high-energy sensor sweep. It cycles every five-point-five minutes. Between those cycles there's a window of a fiftieth of a second.  Trust me. I can get through.
The current cycle is almost finished, sir... they'll be phase aligning in twenty seconds...
The delegation is ready to come aboard, sir.
The only people left alive were in an outlying district of the settlement... I was sent there, with a squad, to reinforce them.
The phaser was set at maximum. The man just... incinerated... there, before my eyes.
There were some skirmishes... when I was with Captain Maxwell.
There you are... potato casserole -- a dish fit for kings.
There's a reason for what he's doing. Those Cardassians were up to something, I'm sure of it.
Tomorrow night... kidney pie. And then maybe pot roast... beef tongue...
We served together a long time... after you've been through what we have... you kind of get inside a person. He might listen.
What is it?
What? Oh... just an old song...
Will Kayden...  Stompie.
With Captain Maxwell, the morning after the massacre. We got there too late, of course... almost everyone was dead...
Yes, sir.
Yes. He is.
Yessir.
Yessir.
You do?
You know... sitting with the staff this morning, I could tell there were people in that room who still don't like the Cardassians.
